page.title: 04PETERHEAD GOLF CLUB
page.content: Peterhead Golf Club was founded in 1841.There is a 9 hole course and an 18 hole course.On role at the club there are 500 men,50 women and 100 juniors.The course is described as a seaside-links type course.It has a par 70.There are 12 par 4 holes,4 par 3 holes and 2 par 5 holes.It is 6000 yards long and has a standard scratch score of 69.The highest handicap of Peterhead Golf Club is 28.The most common are between 10 and 18.There are 1 or 2 playing off scratch to +1.The Golf Club employs 4 green-keepers.In the club there is 1 steward and 1 part time steward.The Club captain this year is Graham Hood.The Club secretary is Bill Noble.The golf club's busiest night is Saturday,when most members enjoy the nineteenth hole!
